en: What do you want to hear about first, Future Jerry?
zh: 你想先聽什麼呢，未來的傑瑞？

en: The blood?
zh: 血？

en: The shirt?
zh: 襯衫？

en: Would you rather hear about the knife?
zh: 還是想先聽刀的事呢？

en: How about the phone call to Hans?
zh: 打電話給漢斯怎麼樣？

en: Or would you rather hear it from the beginning?
zh: 或者你更願意讓我從頭開始說起嗎？

en: Yes?
zh: 是的嗎？

en: The beginning?
zh: 從頭開始？

en: As you wish.
zh: 好吧，如你所願。

en: The news piece was about Jerry Grey, Alzheimer’s sufferer, whose unfortunate lapse of Alzheimer’s judgment was caught on video and has now been viewed by over one million people.
zh: 新聞的核心人物是傑瑞·格雷，一個阿爾茨海默病患者，很不幸，他因阿爾茨海默病犯下過錯，並且被拍成視頻傳到網上，目前已經有上百萬人觀看。

en: Porn and providing a place to rub salt into the wounds of others at their lowest moments—those are the Internet’s two biggest contributions to the world.
zh: 淫穢視頻和在處於人生最低谷的人的傷口上撒鹽，這就是互聯網對世界的兩大貢獻。

en: The last thing you remember from yesterday is writing in your journal, hiding it away, and then having a few drinks with the plan of sneaking out the window to find somewhere to have a few more.
zh: 你昨天還記得寫日記，記得把它藏起來，喝幾杯酒，計劃鬼鬼祟祟地跳到窗外，找個地方再多喝幾杯。

en: You can remember breathing in the fresh air as you crawled out.
zh: 你還記得爬出窗外后，大口大口地呼吸著新鮮空氣。

en: You were drunk, the perfect amount of buzz where it wasn’t going to worry you how far you had to walk, or how much a drink was going to cost, or what kind of bar you ended up in.
zh: 你喝醉了，所以不必擔心你走得有多遠，不必擔心一杯酒多少錢，或者身處什麼酒吧。

en: Only if any of that happened, you don’t know.
zh: 即使這些都發生了，你也不知道。

en: What you do know is that Captain A took over sometime after you wrote in your journal, and when he let go of the controls it was six in the morning and you were sitting on the couch. Your joints were stiff and your feet were sore, and you felt like you’d walked a few miles. You were naked from the waist up.
zh: 你只知道，「阿爾茨船長」有時在你寫完日記之後會接手，等他再放你自由，已經是早上六點鐘了，你呆坐在沙發上，關節僵硬，雙腳酸痛，上身赤|裸，好像你走了好幾公里似的。

en: You didn’t even notice the blood at first.
zh: 你起初甚至沒有發現血跡。

en: You made your way into the bathroom, and that’s when you saw yourself in the mirror.
zh: 你走進洗手間，在鏡子里看到自己。

en: Jerry Grey looking very pale and tired. Jerry Grey with crows-feet around his eyes and mouth.
zh: 傑瑞·格雷看起來面色蒼白，疲倦不堪，他眼角布滿魚尾紋，嘴角滿是法令紋。

en: Jerry Grey naked from the waist up but with smears of blood on his chest and arms and face.
zh: 傑瑞上身赤|裸著，胸前、手臂和臉上有成片的血跡。

en: Want to take a stab at what was going on, Henry?
zh: 想弄清楚發生了什麼事情嗎，亨利？

en: Jerry was in the off position. Jerry had no clue what was going on.
zh: 傑瑞的大腦死機了，傑瑞根本不知道發生了什麼事情。

en: Jerry’s world was going to get much worse later that day, but he didn’t know it then.
zh: 那天晚上之後傑瑞的世界更糟糕了，但他不知道。

en: You opened the bedroom door, and the world was swaying, and you knew if you found Sandra in there with blood all over the walls, you would scream until your throat tore, until your ears popped, you would scream yourself to death.
zh: 你打開卧室門，感覺天旋地轉，要是你發現桑德拉在那裡，牆壁上滿是鮮血，你肯定扯著嗓子尖叫，震耳欲聾，至死方休。

en: But there was no blood.
zh: 但還好，沒有血跡。

en: You stood for a minute watching her sleep before going back down to the office.
zh: 你站在那裡，端詳著熟睡中的她，過了一分鐘才回到寫作房。

en: You couldn’t find your shirt. It wasn’t in the laundry, wasn’t in the bathroom, then you thought . . .
zh: 你找不到你的襯衫了，不在洗衣房，不在洗手間。

en: if Captain A had steered you into trouble, perhaps he had tried to cover it up?
zh: 你心想，如果「阿爾茨船長」想誘導你陷入困境，那麼他會把所有真相都掩蓋起來。也許他已經掩蓋了起來。

en: Perhaps he had hidden the evidence. You moved your desk, used the screwdriver on the floor, and found your shirt under there.
zh: 你移動辦公桌，用螺絲刀撬動地板，發現了藏在下面的襯衫。

en: It wasn’t a wedding shirt anymore, but a funeral shirt, made to look that way by the blood on it.
zh: 這不再是婚禮的襯衫了，而真正是葬禮的襯衫，因為上面染滿血跡。

en: You left it under the floor and put everything back into place.
zh: 你又把它放回地板下，並把所有的東西歸位。

en: You went and closed the office window that was still open, the window you had climbed out of as Jerry Grey, but by the time you climbed back in you were somebody else.
zh: 你走過去，關上開著的窗戶，你曾以傑瑞·格雷的身份從窗口爬到屋外，但爬回來時不再是傑瑞·格雷了。

en: You were Captain A, but Captain A has another name, doesn’t he.
zh: 你是「阿爾茨船長」，「阿爾茨船長」還有另一個名字，對吧？

en: He goes by Henry Cutter.
zh: 他是亨利·卡特。

en: And that shirt made it obvious that Henry likes to write what he knows.
zh: 很明顯，那件襯衫說明，亨利喜歡寫他所知道的一切。

en: Why?
zh: 「為什麼？」

en: Why do you think, Jerry?
zh: 「你說為什麼，傑瑞？」

en: You told her you were sorry.
zh: 你告訴她你很抱歉。

en: I know you are, she said, but it doesn’t change anything.
zh: 「我知道你有悔意，」她說，「但一切都不會改變的。」

en: Go and take a shower and I’ll make you some lunch.
zh: 去洗個澡，中午我給你做飯。」

en: You thought about telling her, but how could you?
zh: 你想過告訴她，但怎麼告訴她呢？

en: What could you say?
zh: 你能說什麼呢？

en: You went and showered and put on some fresh clothes and came back downstairs.
zh: 你洗完澡，換上乾淨衣服，走下樓來。

en: Sandra was in the office. There was a sandwich on your desk.
zh: 桑德拉在寫作房，你辦公桌上放著個三明治。

en: She was tidying up, she was picking the jacket up, and while she was picking it up she was asking where your shirt was.
zh: 她正在整理房間。她手裡拿著外套，問你襯衫在哪裡。

en: Before you could lie and tell her you didn’t know, she hung the jacket over her arm.
zh: 還沒有等你撒謊說你不知道，她已經把外套搭在手臂上了。她頓住了。

en: Since you’re a Let’s guess what happens a third of the way through guy, then you already know it was the knife she found in there.
zh: 每當故事演繹到三分之一你就能猜出結果來，所以你已經明白她在口袋裡發現了刀。

en: She pulled it out and held it away, the same way she does sometimes when she’s holding hair she just pulled out of the shower drain.
zh: 她把它抽出來，捏在手上，這跟她偶爾把從浴室排水溝里抽出的頭髮捏在手裡時的動作一樣。

en: You could both see it wasn’t one of your kitchen knives and you could both see the blood on it and you could both see the horror on each other’s face.
zh: 你們兩個都可以看得很清楚這並不是你們的菜刀，你們倆都可以看到刀刃上的血跡，你們倆都可以看到對方臉上恐怖的神情。

en: This knife with a blade no longer than six inches, its dark wooden handle, its serrated edge, this little knife that was the biggest knife in the world.
zh: 這把刀長不足六英寸，深色刀柄，邊緣有鋸齒，這把小刀將是世界上最大的刀。

en: What the hell is this, Jerry?
zh: 「這到底是什麼，傑瑞？」

en: Seeing that knife told you that as bad as the WMD had been, you had managed to top it. It put the bloody shirt into a different context. Jerry? I don’t know.
zh: 看著眼前這把刀，你心裏很清楚，這跟搞砸婚禮一樣糟糕，你本來應該給它配上刀套的，它的存在讓帶血的襯衫有了不同的意義。

en: You were standing in the doorway with hair dripping wet even though you had gotten dressed, and then you realized all of you was dripping wet.
zh: 你站在門廳，淋濕的頭髮吧嗒吧嗒往下滴著水，你已經穿好衣服了，但你意識到自己渾身都還濕漉漉的。

en: At first you thought it was sweat, but then you realized you hadn’t dried yourself after the shower, that you had just put your clothes straight on.
zh: 起初你以為是汗水，但後來你意識到你剛洗完澡，沒有擦乾身子就把衣服穿上了。

en: I don’t know.
zh: 「我不知道。」

en: Stop saying you don’t know. Please, Jerry, think.
zh: 「拜託，不要說你不知道，傑瑞。

en: You need to think.
zh: 你想想，你需要好好想想。

en: This has blood on it, she said. It’s blood!
zh: 這兒有血，」她說，「這是血！」

en: We don’t know that, you said, hoping it might be something else.
zh: 「我們不知道。」你說。希望它能變成別的什麼東西，或者醬油，或者顏料。

en: Maybe sauce. Maybe paint. Whatever was on the knife was probably the same stuff you got on your shirt.
zh: 刀上的東西可能就是你弄到襯衫上的東西。

en: Something that looked like blood but certainly wasn’t.
zh: 那東西看起來像血，但肯定不是血。

en: It’s blood, she said.
zh: 「是血。」她說。

en: I don’t know, you said, and you said it a few times, over and over.
zh: 「我不知道。」你一連說了好幾遍，一遍又一遍。

en: While you said it Sandra had her own words that she said over and over, and hers were, What have you done, Jerry, what have you done?
zh: 你在說話時桑德拉也在說，一遍又一遍地說，她說的是：「你做了什麼？傑瑞，你做了什麼？」

en: What have you done?
zh: 你做了什麼？

en: Sandra wants to call the police.
zh: 桑德拉想要打電話報警。

en: You’ve begged her not to, after all, nothing was certain, everything was unknown.
zh: 你祈求她不要，畢竟一切還不能肯定，一切都還是未知的。

en: She called Eva instead and asked her how her lunch went, and asked if anybody else hadn’t shown up.
zh: 她打電話給伊娃，問她午餐怎麼樣，問她還有沒有別的人沒有去。

en: Everybody was accounted for. Even Rick’s best man who had put the video online, and if you were going to stab anybody to death it would have been him. It should have been him.
zh: 她說大家都到齊了，包括瑞克最好的朋友，正是他最好的朋友把視頻傳到網上的。

en: Sandra agreed she wouldn’t call the police. Not at that stage.
zh: 桑德拉同意不報警，只是暫時不報警。

en: But she would, if anything showed up on her radar.
zh: 但是，如果她還發現了別的東西，她就會報警。

en: You called Hans. You told him everything about the shirt, the knife, the blood.
zh: 你打電話給漢斯，把一切都告訴了他，包括襯衫、刀、血。

en: He said you probably just found the knife somewhere. It was actually a really simple explanation.
zh: 他說你可能是在別的地方發現刀的，這其實是個非常簡單的辯解。

en: He said the blood could be from anywhere, from a cow, a dog, or maybe it wasn’t even blood.
zh: 他說血可能來自別的地方，比如牛、狗的身上，也許這甚至不是血。

en: There’s no point in worrying about something you can’t know about, he said.
zh: 「擔心你不知道的事情沒有絲毫意義。」

en: Worry if you learn more, but until then, just try to act normal, he said, and you could picture him using his fingers to make quotation marks around the normal part, the same way people will be doing at your trial during their Jerry used to be normal cross-examinations.
zh: 他說，「等你了解了詳情，那才值得擔憂。但在那之前，就試著一切如常吧。」他說，你可以看見他在說到「如常」這個詞時用手指畫了個感嘆號，在人們對你進行「傑瑞是否還和以前一樣如常」的審訊時，他們也會做這個動作。

en: There’s nothing to remember, he said, or words to that effect.
zh: 「什麼也不用記得。」他如是說，或大致是這個意思。

en: You don’t know whether he was being vague, or whether he feared the worst.
zh: 你不知道他的話是不是模稜兩可的含義，或者他是不是在擔心已經出現最壞的情況。

en: Is it possible you just found the knife somewhere, like he said?
zh: 是不是真就像他說的那樣，你在別的地方發現了刀？

en: Good news—really?
zh: 好消息：真的嗎？

en: You think there’s good news?
zh: 你以為還有好消息？

en: Bad news—the bloody shirt, the bloody knife, is it possible you’re more than just a dessert guy?
zh: 壞消息：血淋淋的襯衫，血淋淋的刀，會不會你真的不僅僅是一個喜歡甜點的人？

en: Jerry is getting off the couch when a photograph of him is shown on the TV, his name beneath it.
zh: 傑瑞正要從沙發上起來，這時他看見電視上出現了他的照片，下面是他的名字。

en: The reporter says, “Jerry Grey, who became an Internet sensation last year with video of him giving a speech at his daughter’s wedding, has been linked to the crime scene by an anonymous source.”
zh: 記者說：「傑瑞·格雷，因在他女兒婚禮上的講話的一段視頻，去年在互聯網上走紅，如今因一則匿名消息來源被認為與罪案現場有牽連。」

en: Then Internet Sensation Jerry Grey shows up on the TV calling his wife a whore, his daughter and her new husband looking shocked in the background of the slightly shaky footage, and the hit counter keeps ticking over. Jerry Grey. Shot to fame.
zh: 在微微搖晃的背景下出現了「網路紅人傑瑞·格雷」罵自己的妻子是婊子的畫面，在他身後是他滿臉震驚的女兒和她的新婚丈夫。

en: Jerry Grey.
zh: 傑瑞·格雷，一炮走紅。

en: Somebody will write a song or a TV movie about him.
zh: 有人會把他的故事改編成歌曲或拍成電視、電影。

en: He sits back down as the wedding footage ends and then it’s back to today’s crime scene, cops moving around in the background, somebody in a suit carrying a fat metal briefcase, somebody with a camera hanging around their neck while they reach into a bag for a different lens.
zh: 婚禮錄像結束后，他坐了回去。電視畫面重新顯示著今天的案發現場，警察在來回走動，一個穿西裝的男人背著個有金屬配飾的公文包，另一些脖子上掛著相機的記者正在包里摸索著鏡頭。

en: Today’s field reporter has the look of a working-class man, sleeves rolled up and no tie, and that makes the news far more real, so jaw-droppingly urgent this man didn’t have time to put on a jacket or a tie or even shave.
zh: 今天到場的記者看起來很像工薪族，袖子卷著，沒打領帶，這使新聞顯得更加真實。好像因為情況緊迫，這人沒空穿外套打領帶，甚至連鬍子都沒刮就跑了過來。

en: “Details are sketchy, but what appears to be a murder weapon has been located, and evidence at this stage suggests a connection to the former crime writer, which in itself suggests that Grey may now be living inside one of the realities he used to create.
zh: 眼下，有證據顯示這位前犯罪小說家與這個案件有關，這表明，格雷現在生活在他曾虛構的現實之中。

en: Furthermore, a bloody shirt found yesterday at the last residence of Jerry Grey connects him to the homicide of Belinda Murray, a Christchurch florist who was murdered last year, two days before Grey went on to kill his wife.
zh: 此外，昨天在傑瑞·格雷以前的住處發現的一件帶有血跡的襯衫表明他是殺死貝琳達·穆雷的兇手，貝琳達·穆雷是克萊斯特徹奇市的一間花店的老闆，去年曾被人謀殺，就在格雷殺死他妻子的前兩天。

en: “We can’t go to the police until we find your journal,” Hans says.
zh: 漢斯說：「我們去警局前得先找到你的日記。」

en: “It doesn’t matter anymore,” Jerry says.
zh: 「那已經不重要了。」傑瑞說。

en: “Of course it does.
zh: 「當然重要。

en: If there’s a chance—”
zh: 如果有機會——」

en: “Fine, then let’s not go to the police. Let’s go for option number three.
zh: 「好吧，那我們就先不去警局，我們就選擇第三條路。

en: I just want to escape everything. Can we do that?”
zh: 我只是想逃避一切，可以嗎？」

en: Hans says nothing for a few seconds, then slowly nods. “Do you know what you’re saying?”
zh: 好一會兒，漢斯沒有說話，他慢慢地點頭說：「你知道你在說什麼嗎？」

en: “I know exactly what I’m saying.
zh: 「我當然知道我在說什麼。

en: Will you help me?”
zh: 你會幫我嗎？」

en: “If that’s what you want.”
zh: 「如果你想要，我就幫你。」

en: “I want to talk to Eva first,” Jerry says.
zh: 「我希望先跟伊娃談談。」傑瑞說。

en: “You can’t tell her.”
zh: 「你不能告訴她。」

en: “I know. I just want to hear her voice.
zh: 「我知道，我只是想聽聽她的聲音。

en: I want to tell her I’m sorry.”
zh: 我想告訴她，我很抱歉。」

en: “Okay.”
zh: 「好吧。」

en: Hans dials Eva’s number as they walk back through the house.
zh: 他們向房外走去，同時漢斯撥打著伊娃的電話。

en: Jerry remembers that Hans has always been good with numbers. If Hans ever gets his own Captain A, numbers will be the last thing to go.
zh: 傑瑞記得漢斯一向精於記住電話號碼，如果漢斯也被「阿爾茨船長」掌控，他最後丟失的才會是這些電話號碼。

en: Eva answers the phone and Hans tells her that he’s with Jerry, and that Jerry is okay.
zh: 伊娃接聽了電話，漢斯告訴她他正與傑瑞在一起，傑瑞很好。

en: Then he says yes and no a few times as she fires some questions at him, then he says nothing as she gives him an update of her own, by which point they’re leaning against the car in the garage.
zh: 然後她問了他幾個問題，他不斷地說「是」或「不」。接著，她說起了她的近況，他一言不發地聽著。這時他們已經來到車庫，靠在車椅上。

en: “I know you are,” she says, “and we can talk about that later.
zh: 「我知道。」她說，「這個話題我們可以稍後再談。

en: I’ll meet you at the police station with your lawyer, okay?”
zh: 我會和你的律師在警局等你，好嗎？」

en: “Sounds good,” he says, and he pictures her sitting there waiting, waiting, and he never shows up.
zh: 「這主意聽起來不錯。」他說。他腦海中浮現出一幅畫面：她坐在那裡等待著，等待著，可他卻一直沒有露面。

en: The nice view, the sun on his face, pills and booze—that’s where he’ll be.
zh: 這幅畫面很美，陽光照耀在他臉上，他就著酒精吞下藥片，這才是他的下場。

en: “Jerry . . . there’s something you need to know.”
zh: 「傑瑞，有些事情你需要知道。」

en: He breaks out in a cold sweat and almost drops the phone.
zh: 他嚇得一身冷汗，差點兒丟掉電話。

en: Nothing good ever comes after those words.
zh: 那些話后准沒什麼好事。

en: “The shirt found yesterday, it was—”
zh: 「昨天發現了一件襯衫，這是——」

en: “I know,” he tells her.
zh: 「我知道。」

en: “I saw it on the news.”
zh: 他告訴她說，「我在新聞里看到了。」

en: “What wasn’t on the news is that the police have been searching your room at the nursing home.”
zh: 「還有新聞里沒有報道的事情：警方搜查了你在療養院的房間。」

en: Hans comes back into the garage.
zh: 漢斯回到車庫。

en: He’s carrying two bottles of gin and has a bottle of tonic tucked under his arm.
zh: 他手裡拿著兩瓶杜松子酒，腋下夾著一瓶奎寧水。

en: He has a sad look on his face. He climbs into the car.
zh: 他坐上汽車，神色憂傷。

en: “They found a small envelope with jewelry in it,” Eva says, carrying on.
zh: 「他們發現一個裝著首飾的小信封。」伊娃接著說。

en: Not Sandra’s, no. Remember what you had in your hand when you switched on earlier?
zh: 他問。接著內心就傳來了亨利的回答：「不是桑德拉的，不是。還記得之前你手裡有過什麼嗎？」

en: He reaches into his pocket and the earrings are still there.
zh: 他把手伸進口袋，耳環仍然在裏面。

en: “No, not Mom’s,” Eva says.
zh: 「不，不是媽媽的。

en: “But they seem to think . . . it’s . . .” she says, but then she starts crying.
zh: 但他們好像認定……是……」伊娃說，但後來她開始哭了。

en: “I can’t do this.
zh: 「伊娃——」「我做不到。

en: I love you, Jerry, but I can’t do this, I’m so sorry,” she says, and then she’s gone, the line is dead, and Jerry stares at the phone willing her to return, willing for things to be different.
zh: 我愛你，傑瑞，但我做不到，我很抱歉。」她說。然後她掛斷電話。傑瑞盯著手機，盼望著她再打過來，盼望著事情有所轉機。

en: He climbs into the car and hands the phone to Hans, who slips it into his pocket.
zh: 他坐回車裡，把手機遞給漢斯，漢斯裝進口袋。

en: “She hung up on me.”
zh: 「她把電話掛斷了。」

en: “I’m sorry, buddy.”
zh: 「我很遺憾，老兄。」

en: “The police have been searching my room and they found something.”
zh: 「警察一直在搜查我的房間，他們好像發現了什麼。」

en: “She told me,” Hans says. “The pieces belong to three women, all of whom were killed on days you were found wandering in town.
zh: 漢斯說：「她告訴我，這些東西屬於三個女人的，三個女人都是你在城裡遊盪時被人殺死的。

en: I’m sorry, buddy, but it really . . . well . . .
zh: 對不起，老兄，但這的確是真的……好吧……

en: I’m not sure what to say.”
zh: 我不知道該說些什麼。」

en: Jerry closes his eyes. How many have there been?
zh: 傑瑞閉上了眼睛，還有多少人呢？

en: Hans uses the remote to open the garage door. He starts the car and they back down the driveway.
zh: 漢斯用遙控器打開車庫門，他發動汽車，駛進車道。

en: “There’s more,” Hans says.
zh: 「還有更多人。」漢斯說。

en: “I don’t want to hear it.”
zh: 「我不想聽。」

en: “One of the orderlies says you told him last night you killed Laura Hunt.
zh: 「一個護理員說你昨晚告訴他，你殺死了勞拉·亨特。

en: She was killed last week in her own home.
zh: 上個星期她在自己家裡遭人殺害。

en: He said he dismissed what you were saying, that he thought you’d probably seen it on the news and you got mixed up the way you’ve been doing lately.
zh: 他說他反駁了你，他認為你可能在新聞里看到這個消息，把它和你最近做的事搞混了。

en: Now, of course, he sees it differently. As do the police.
zh: 不過現在他有不同的看法了，警察也有不同的看法。

en: It was the day you were found in the library.”
zh: 這事就發生在你在圖書館被發現的那一天。」

en: If people had listened to his confession, they could have stopped the monster.
zh: 要是人們可以聽到他的懺悔，他們可能會阻止這頭怪物。

en: But all they heard was Captain A making shit up.
zh: 但是，他們所聽到的都是「阿爾茨船長」的扯淡。

en: “You promise you’ll stay with me till the end, right?
zh: 「你保證會陪我走到最後，對吧？

en: You’ll make sure everything goes okay?”
zh: 你確定一切都會好起來的，對吧？」

en: “I promise,” Hans says.
zh: 「我保證。」漢斯說。

en: Jerry thinks of his Eva, and the pain he is sparing her.
zh: 傑瑞想著他的伊娃，想著他給她帶來的痛苦。

en: “The journal,” Hans says.
zh: 「那本日記。」漢斯說，「你確定嗎？

en: “Are you sure about it? Are you absolutely sure you had one?”
zh: 你真的確定你有嗎？」

en: “Without a doubt.” “Where else could you have hidden it?”
zh: 「你還有可能把它藏在哪裡？」

en: Jerry closes his eyes. He pictures his office.
zh: 傑瑞閉上眼睛，腦海中浮現出他的寫作房。

en: He can see the floor, he can see himself prying up one of the boards with a screwdriver.
zh: 他可以看到地板，可以看到自己正用螺絲刀撬動地板。

en: “There was nowhere else.”
zh: 「沒有了。」

en: “If I were to sneak in there later tonight to look for it, where would I start?”
zh: 「如果我今天晚上悄悄進到房子去找，我應該從哪裡下手？」

en: “You’d do that for me?
zh: 「你會幫我嗎？

en: You’d hide it if there are bad things in there?”
zh: 如果那上面有對我不利的記錄你會把它藏起來嗎？」

en: “I’d destroy it.
zh: 「我會把它毀掉。

en: But where would I look, Jerry?”
zh: 但我該從哪裡下手呢，傑瑞？」

en: “I don’t know.”
zh: 「我不知道。」

en: “It’s important,” Hans says.
zh: 「這很重要。」漢斯說。

en: “I know,” Jerry says, scratching at his arm harder now.
zh: 「我知道。」傑瑞說，他在手臂上抓撓得更凶了。

en: “What’s wrong with your arm?”
zh: 「你的胳膊到底怎麼了？」

en: Hans asks.
zh: 漢斯問。

en: Jerry looks down to see his nails dragging across his skin. He’s been doing that a lot lately.
zh: 傑瑞低頭看他的指甲在皮膚上撓來撓去，最近這個動作他做得很頻繁。

en: He rolls up the sleeve of his shirt, exposing the needle mark that looks raw and inflamed.
zh: 他捲起袖子，露出針痕，看起來已經擦破皮發炎了。

en: “Come on, let’s go before we miss the sunset.”
zh: 他說，「好了，我們走吧，不然日落之前就趕不到了。」

en: “Show me your arm,” Hans says.
zh: 「讓我看看你的胳膊。」漢斯說。

en: “Why?”
zh: 「為什麼？」

en: “Because I asked.”
zh: 「我想看。」

en: Jerry shows him his arm.
zh: 傑瑞伸出自己的手臂。

en: “They’ve been injecting you?” he asks, and they’re still in the driveway.
zh: 「他們已經開始給你打針了？」他問，他們仍然在車道上。

en: “Just yesterday, when we went to look for the journal.
zh: 「就是昨天，我們去找日記的時候。

en: They had to give me a shot to calm me down. I told you that already.
zh: 他們給我打了一針，好讓我鎮靜下來，我跟你說過的。

en: I guess my skin is a little irritated.”
zh: 我想我的皮膚有點兒過敏。」

en: “You’ve got a few other marks there,” he says.
zh: 「還有幾處痕迹。」他說。

en: “I don’t remember the other time.”
zh: 「別的我就不記得了。」

en: They make a habit of injecting the people at the nursing home?”
zh: 他們在療養院經常給人打針嗎？」

en: “I don’t think so.
zh: 「倒也不是。

en: Like I said, they did it yesterday because we were at the house, and—”
zh: 我說過了，昨天他們給我打了針，因為我們在那座房子里，而且——」

en: Hans shakes his head before interrupting him.
zh: 漢斯搖了搖頭，打斷他的話頭。

en: “Let me think a moment,” he says, his voice hardening.
zh: 「讓我想想。」他說，他的語氣有點兒生硬。

en: “Why?”
zh: 「為什麼？」

en: “Just shut up. Let me think.”
zh: 「閉嘴，讓我想想。」

en: Jerry shuts up. He lets his friend think.
zh: 傑瑞閉上嘴，讓他的朋友思考。

en: “There is something that has been bothering me about this all along,” he says.
zh: 「這段時間，有些事一直困擾著我。」

en: “The nursing home is a long way out of the city. It’s a good fifteen miles.
zh: 他說，「療養院距離市裡有很長很長一段路程，起碼有二十五公里。

en: Just how do you think you covered that distance?
zh: 想想看，這麼遠的距離你是怎麼走的？

en: You didn’t drive, right?”
zh: 你沒開車，對吧？」

en: “I don’t know for sure.
zh: 「我不知道。

en: I think I walked.”
zh: 我想，我就是走著去的。」

en: “It’s a long walk.”
zh: 「這是段很長的路。」

en: “It’s the only explanation.”
zh: 「但這是唯一的解釋了。」

en: “Do you remember walking?”
zh: 「你還記得走在路上的情景嗎？」

en: “No.”
zh: 「不記得了。」

en: “So let’s say you did walk.
zh: 「所以我們可以先假設你沒有走進城裡。

en: In which case you walked aimlessly all that way to the house of somebody you had never met,” he says.
zh: 在這種情況下，你只是漫無目的地走進了你從來沒有見過的人的家裡。」

en: “With your neighbor when you were young, and with the florist, you knew them.
zh: 他說，「有你小時候的鄰居、花店老闆，你認識他們。

en: Why would you kill people you don’t know?
zh: 但你為什麼會殺死那些你不認識的人呢？

en: How did you choose them?”
zh: 你是怎麼選定他們的呢？」

en: “At random,” Jerry says, because it’s the only senseless answer that makes any kind of sense.
zh: 「隨機的吧。」傑瑞說。現在這是唯一一個毫無道理的答案，卻能解釋當下的問題。

en: “If it was random, why somewhere close to town? Why not somewhere on the outskirts of town?
zh: 「如果是隨機的，那為什麼要靠近城鎮，而不在郊外呢？

en: If you walked, you would have passed through dozens and dozens of other streets. A thousand homes. Two thousand.
zh: 如果你走進城裡，你會經過好幾十條街道，經過一兩千戶人家。

en: Why walk fifteen miles to the edge of town, then another five miles to the victim’s house, especially when it’s somebody completely random?”
zh: 你為什麼非要走二十五公里到城郊，再走五公里到受害者家裡呢？尤其是在完全隨機的情況下？」

en: “I don’t make those decisions,” Jerry says.
zh: 「我不負責做這些決定。」

en: “It doesn’t make sense,” Hans says.
zh: 「這話沒有意義。」漢斯說。

en: Hans starts drumming his fingers again. “All that walking, and then you go up to the door of a house you’ve never seen before, and a woman you don’t know lets you in.
zh: 漢斯又開始敲擊他的手指了：「所有這一切——步行進城，到你從未見過的人的家門前，一個你素不相識的女人放你進去。

en: You choose the house of a woman who somehow you know is alone. That’s what we’re saying here, right?”
zh: 偏偏你所選擇的女人都是獨居，這就是癥結所在了，對吧？」

en: Before Jerry can answer, Hans carries on. “Twenty miles between where that woman died and the nursing home, and you’ve got injection marks on your arms.
zh: 還沒等傑瑞回答，漢斯繼續說，「那個女人死的地方距離療養院有三十公里，而你的手臂上又有針眼。

en: You can remember everything after but nothing before.”
zh: 你可以記得之後的一切，但之前的事什麼都不記得了。」

en: “What are you saying?”
zh: 「你到底在說什麼？」

en: Hans uses the remote control to open the garage door back up.
zh: 漢斯把車沿原路開了回去，用遙控器打開車庫門。

en: They drive inside. He unclips his seat belt and looks over at Jerry. “I’m saying there’s a reason why it seems so convenient you can’t remember killing any of these women, or breaking into their houses. I’m saying maybe you didn’t do this after all.”
zh: 他們開車進去，鬆開安全帶，漢斯看著傑瑞：「我在說，你之所以不記得殺害這些女人或闖入她們家中，並且這麼心安理得，很有可能是因為這些事根本就不是你乾的。」
